version.description: The optimistic locking version of the app config. This value must be submitted as part of the next update of the model. If it does not match the value on the server, a 409 error (Conflict) will prevent the update from occurring. It can also serve as a key to determine if a local cache of `AppConfig` needs to be updated.

AppConfigElement.description: An element of an app configuration object.

id.description: The identifier for this app config element. All revisions of this element will have the same id.

revision.description: Revision number of the app config element, used to distinguish revisions of the element. Each revision will also have an optimistic locking `version` which should always be passed back as is when updating a specific revision of the element.

deleted.description: Has this app config element been logically deleted (an admin can restore it)?

data.description: The JSON data of this element.

createdOn.description: The date and time the app config was created.

modifiedOn.description: The date and time the app config was last modified.

version.description: The optimistic locking version of the app config element. This value must be submitted as part of the next update of the model. If it does not match the value on the server, a 409 error (Conflict) will prevent the update from occurring. It can also serve as a key to determine if a local cache of this `AppConfigElement` revision needs to be updated.

Assessment.description: The assessment object contains the general cataloguing information we have on an assessment, and includes both a set of links to documents that describe the assessment and its use, as well as a configuration object for client applications. An assessment can be defined in an app context, or it can be shared in our shared assessment libary. Assessments are globally visible to all study authors in an app context, but are owned by a specific organization, and only members of that organization can edit the assessment. When shared, the configuration for an assessment is immutable and there are no APIs to update it.

guid.description: Each assessment revision is assigned a unique GUID which can be used to retrieve it through the API. Assessments will also have a unique combination of an identifier and a revision, and can be retrieved as a set of revisions under a given identifier.

identifier.description: A human-readable identifier for an assessment, which can have one or more revisions.

ownerId.description: The ID of the organization that owns this assessment. Only members of that organization will be able to edit the assessment, either in an app context or in the shared assessment library.

title.description: A name for the assessment that is shown to study designers, but not to study participants if there are labels that can be shown instead.

labels.description: A collection of labels for this assessment. Only one label can be included for each language, and if the userâ€™s language cannot be selected, English will be selected as a default. If an English label does not exist, then the assessment title can be used instead.

osName.description: The name of the operating system (conventional names are "Android," "iPhone OS," and "Both").

originGuid.description: If this assessment was copied from a shared assessment, this will be the GUID of the shared assessment revision that was used to make this copy. Certain aspects of the assessment (notably, the assessment's configuration) are guaranteed to be identical to this origin assessment.

minutesToComplete.description: The number of minutes it takes for a participant to complete this assessment.

tags.description: A set of tags that apply to this assessment. Tags should be namespaced with a prefix followed by a period (e.g. "category.neurodegenerative"), as the tag API will give you these tags in a map keyed from the prefix to a list of the values under that prefix.

customizationFields.description: A map of AssessmentNode GUIDs to a set of field identifiers in that node that can be customized by developers without invalidating an assessment (the assessment will maintain its link to the shared assessment it was derived from, if any, and the authors of the assessment are confident that these changes to the configuration will not invalidate the scientific validity of the assessment). This specification guides validation of submissions to update an AssessmentNode through a specific customization API.

createdOn.description: The date and time the assessment was created.

modifiedOn.description: The date and time the assessment was last modified.

deleted.description: Has this assessment been logically deleted (an admin can restore it)?

version.description: The optimistic locking version of the assessment. This value must be submitted as part of the next update of the model. If it does not match the value on the server, a 409 error (Conflict) will prevent the update from occurring. It can also serve as a key to determine if a local cache of `Assessment` needs to be updated.

config.description: The JSON configuration for this assessment.

createdOn.description: The date and time the app config was created.

modifiedOn.description: The date and time the app config was last modified.

version.description: The optimistic locking version of the assessment config. This value must be submitted as part of the next update of the model. If it does not match the value on the server, a 409 error (Conflict) will prevent the update from occurring. It can also serve as a key to determine if a local cache of this `AssessmentConfig` revision needs to be updated.

AssessmentInfo.description: Information about an assessment in order to render it in a UI prior to execution.

key.description: Because assessments can be configured with different display information, they are not referenced in the schedule portion of a timeline by their GUIDs. Instead they are given a unique string key that is used to look up the assessment.

guid.description: Each assessment revision is assigned a unique GUID which can be used to retrieve it through the API. Assessments will also have a unique combination of an identifier and a revision, and can be retrieved as a set of revisions under a given identifier.

identifier.description: A human-readable identifier for an assessment, which can have one or more revisions.

revision.description: The revision of the assessment under the given identifier (the identifier and the revision together are mapped to a single GUID which can be used to reference the assessment; only the GUID is required in this object).

minutesToComplete.description: The number of minutes it takes for a participant to complete this assessment.

configUrl.description: The URL to download the configuration associated with this assessment.

AssessmentReference.description: A pointer to an assessment revision.

appId.description: The identifier of the assessment's app. For a shared assessment, the shared app's ID.

id.description: The identifier of the assessment (should be unique in the set of references)

originSharedId.description: If imported from a shared assessment, the identifier of the shared assessment (this may not be unique between two different references in the set of references)

configHref.description: The URL to retrieve the configuration for this assessment

AssessmentReference2.description: A pointer to an assessment revision. When a schedule is created, many of these fields should be populated with the default values provided by an `Assessment` (including labels, minutes to complete, and the color scheme). This information is part of the `Schedule` and the `Timeline` so mobile apps can render a UI to access an assessment before it needs to be fully loaded and executed. However, given a particular appâ€™s design, some or all of these values may not be needed, and are not required. These values can then be changed by the study designer as part of the schedule. *As a result however, subsequent updates to the original assessmentâ€™s fields will not be reflected in the schedules where the assessment is used.*

appId.description: Schedules can refer to assessments in the shared library (appId = shared) or in their own local assessment library (appId will be the appId of the app in which the study is running).

title.description: A title for this assessment to show to study designers.

identifier.description: The identifier of the assessment (which stays the same regardless of the revision or GUID of the assessment). This token can be used, for example, to load an icon for the assessment from an app binary.

revision.description: The revision of the assessment under the given identifier (the identifier and the revision together are mapped to a single GUID which can be used to reference the assessment; only the GUID is required in this object).

minutesToComplete.description: The number of minutes it takes for a participant to complete this assessment.

labels.description: A collection of labels for this assessment. Only one label can be included for a given language. The system will first try and select the participantâ€™s preferred languages (from most to least preferred), then it will select an English (â€œenâ€) language default label. If an English label does not exist in the list of labels, then the assessmentâ€™s title will be used as a label.

ClientInfo.description: Describes the content of the `User-Agent` field in the format that is accepted and understandable to the Bridge server (see [REST API getting started](/articles/rest.html)).

appName.description: The name of the application (e.g. "Cardio Health").

appVersion.description: The version of the application (must be a number, and should increase with every new release of the application).

osName.description: The name of the operating system (conventional names are "Android" and "iPhone OS").

osVersion.description: The version of the operating system (e.g. "10.0.3").

sdkName.description: The name of the SDK being used (e.g. "BridgeJavaSDK").

sdkVersion.description: The version of the SDK being used (e.g. "4").

CmsPublicKey.description:
A JSON payload that includes the base 64 encoded, public key for CMS encryption of uploads for this 
app. Each app has a different CMS public key.

publicKey.description: Base 64 encoded version of the public key for CMS encryption of upload data.

ColorScheme.description: Colors to differentiate this assessment in a UI.

foreground.description: A color value (in hex color triplet  or

background.description: A color value (in hex color triplet  or

activated.description: A color value (in hex color triplet  or

inactivated.description: A color value (in hex color triplet  or

CompoundActivity.description: A pointer to a compound activity, which represents multiple schemas or survey's worth of tasks for a user to perform. The task ID is used to uniquely identify the compound activity, and the activity can contain one or more schemas or surveys. When creating a Schedule Plan, you should leave the schema and survey lists empty, and the scheduler will automatically resolve the compound activity from a compound activity definition, using the task ID as the key.

taskIdentifier.description: Task ID, used to uniquely identify the compound activity and to resolve the compound activity reference from the compound activity definition, where applicable.

CompoundActivityDefinition.description: A compound activity definition, which lives outside of but parallel to a schedule plan. Schedule plans contain compound activities references (compound activity objects with just a task ID and no schemas or surveys), and the scheduler will automatically resolve and populate the compound activity in returned scheduled activities.

taskId.description: Task ID, used to uniquely identify the compound activity and to resolve the compound activity reference from the compound activity definition, where applicable.

version.description: The optimistic locking version of the survey. This value must be submitted as part of the next update of the model. If it does not match the value on the server, a 409 error (Conflict) will prevent the update from occurring.

ConfigReference.description: A pointer to a configuration element.

ConsentSignature.description:
To consent to participation in a subpopulation (also known as a consent group), participants submit their electronic signature. This can include an image of their actual signature. 

At the time of consent, participants also submit a decision on how widely they will share their medical information with researchers (see the scope property of the ConsentSignature JSON object, below).

How you describe to participants the choice to share research data is important if they are to correctly understand the consequences of this decision. We suggest that applications present the following language to users when making this choice:

* **Option #1:** No data sharing. I do not agree to share my coded data (without my name) at this time;
* **Option #2:** I agree to share my coded data (without my name) with researchers at the sponsor institution, and their partners, in order to conduct this study;
* **Option #3:** I agree to share my coded data (without my name) with qualified researchers worldwide, for general health research.

Note that if your study does re-identify participants in the study, this language will have to be adjusted.

birthdate.description: The participant's date of birth in ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD).

imageData.description: Base 64 encoded image of the participant's signature. If `imageData` is supplied, `imageMimeType` must also be supplied.

imageMimeType.description: Mime type of this image (e.g. "image/png"). If `imageData` is supplied, `imageMimeType` must also be supplied.

signedOn.description: The date and time the referenced consent was signed and agreed to by the participant.

withdrewOn.description: The date and time the participant withdrew consent (can be blank).

ConsentStatus.description: A description of the participant's consent status in a particular subpopulation (consent group). This object is never used to update state on the server (all fields are read only).

subpopulationGuid.description: The GUID for the subpopulation of this consent.

required.description: Is this consent required? If required, the user must consent to it before being given access to the server (until signed, a 412 response is returned for most participant endpoints).

signedOn.description: The date and time the referenced consent was signed and agreed to by the participant. If there is a signedOn value, consented will be equal to true.

consented.description: Has the participant consented to this consent agreement? If the user has signed this consent, there should be a signedOn timestamp value.

signedMostRecentConsent.description: Was the consent to participate made against the most recently published version of this consent? If there's no signature this will be false (not null).

Contact.description: A contact for the study. This is for display to the participants of the study, and in other catalogs of the studies that are available.

CreatedOnHolder.description: An object that provides the creation timestamp for a newly created entity. This object is returned from create and update endpoints rather than an entire entity.

createdOn.description: The timestamp (created on) of the newly created entity.

Criteria.description: Some objects, like Subpopulations and the schedules in a CriteriaScheduleStrategy, are matched against user criteria in order to return the correct object. The criteria against which user information will be matched are described in the Criteria object. See [Customizing Content for Participants](/articles/filtering.html) for a fuller explanation.

language.description: A two-letter language code. The the must declare an `Accept-Language` header with this language in order to match this object.

allOfGroups.description: One or more data groups; the user must have all these data groups to match.

noneOfGroups.description: One or more data groups; the user must have none of these data groups to match.

allOfStudyIds.description: One or more study IDs; the user must be assigned to all these studies to match.

noneOfStudyIds.description: One or more study IDs; the user cannot be assigned to any of these studies for the associated object to match.

minAppVersions.description: A map of operating system names to minimum app versions. The user must send a `User-Agent` header in a prescribed format, that declares the app version to be equal to or greater than this version number, in order to match.

maxAppVersions.description: A map of operating system names to minimum app versions. The user must send a `User-Agent` header in a prescribed format, that declares the app version to be equal to or less than this version number, in order to match.

CriteriaScheduleStrategy.description: Contains a list of schedules, each of which is associated to a specific [Criteria](/#Criteria) object. Based on information submitted by the user and in the user's account settings, compare each schedule in order until one matches the criteria, and use that schedule to assign activities to the user.

scheduleCriteria.description: The list of schedules and their criteria.

CustomActivityEventRequest.description: Request object for creating a Custom Activity Event.

timestamp.description: ISO 8601 date and time to record for event

CustomEvent.description: A study can define one or more unique event identifiers against which a schedule can be designed. The API allows for client applications to submit timestamps for these events, and they are referenced as triggers for specific schedule sessions. All the events defined in a study object must have a unique eventId. Custom events can only be edited for a study during its design phase and are immutable once a study is released.

eventId.description: May contain any characters except a colon.

DataGroups.description: A payload that contains a string array of data groups.

DateRange.description: Model object representing a date range, which includes start date and end date as calendar dates (YYYY-MM-DD).

startDate.description: Start date of the date range (YYYY-MM-DD).

endDate.description: Start date of the date range (YYYY-MM-DD).

EmailSignIn.description: Using a token supplied in an email to the participant, authenticate with the server. The token remains valid, once sent, for a minute. This token will be sent as part of a link in an email to the participant. This link should be intercepted by the installed app, which can extract the parameter in the link and use them to authenticate with the server using this endpoint. (This feature must be enabled for your app.)

appId.description: The identifier of the participant's app.

email.description: The email address of the participant.

token.description: The token that was embedded in a link, sent in an email, that should be intercepted by the app in order to complete sign in.

EmailSignInRequest.description: Make a request to sign in through an email. This request will trigger the email to be sent to an existing account's email address (no more than once per minute). When the user clicks on this link, the installed app should be registered to intercept and handle the link. The link will include a token that can be sent to the server to authenticate. This feature must be enabled for your app.

appId.description: The identifier for the participant's app.

email.description: The email address of the participant.

EmailVerificationStatus.description: The status of the email address that will be used to send consents to users. The consents are sent on behalf of the app using the app's support email address, and our email provider (Amazon's SES) requires that the address holder confirm this is an allowed use of the address.

Enrollment.description: An enrollment of a user in a study

externalId.description: An optional, arbitrary string identifier that identifies this user in an external system (as a member of this study; one external ID can be tracked per study).

userId.description: The ID of the enrolled user

consentRequired.description: If true, this user must still sign consents for the study before they can participate. Despite this, they are being tracked as part of the study.

enrolledOn.description: The timestamp of enrollment (either the timestamp of the consent signature if self-enrolled, or the time the enrollment record was created).

enrolledBy.description: If the user is not enrolled through consenting to participate, this will be the user ID of the API caller who enrolled the user in the study (otherwise it is blank).

withdrawnOn.description: The timestamp of withdrawal from the study (either the timestamp of the revocation of the  consent signature if self-enrolled, or the time the enrollment record was withdrawn).

withdrawnBy.description: If the user is not withdrawing their own consent, this will be the user ID of the API caller who withdrew the user (otherwise it is blank).

withdrawalNote.description: An optional note that can be supplied by the person doing a withdrawal as to why a participant is being removed from the study.

note.description: An optional, study-scoped participant note. Can only be set and accessed by users with administrative roles and access to the study. (eg. Study Coordinators, Researchers, Developers, Study Designers)

EnrollmentDetail.description: Details about the enrollment of a user in a study

enrolledBy.description: This field will be absent if the participant enrolled themselves, otherwise it will contain a reference to the account that enrolled the participant.

withdrawnBy.description: This field will be absent if the participant withdrew themselves from the study, otherwise it will contain a reference to the account that withdrew the participant.

EnrollmentInfo.description: Details about an enrollment for the participant enrolled in the study.

enrolledBySelf.description: If the participant enrolled themselves, the property will be present and true. Otherwise, property will not be in JSON.

withdrawnBySelf.description: If the participant withdrew themselves, the property will be present and true. Otherwise, property will not be in JSON.

Exporter3Configuration.description: This class holds Exporter 3.0 configuration for a given app.

configured.description: True if all configuration attributes are specified.

dataAccessTeamId.description: Synapse team ID that is granted read access to exported health data records.

projectId.description: The Synapse project to export health data records to. It is recommended (but not required) that this is a different project than the one used for Exporter 2.0.

rawDataFolderId.description: The Synapse folder to export raw health data to.

storageLocationId.description: The Synapse storage location that represents our External S3 bucket. This storage location should be STS-enabled.

ExternalIdentifier.description: An external identifier assigned to a participant's account to allow external re-identification of the user by the study sponsor.

studyId.description: The study ID of the study in which this external ID is defined

assigned.description: If true, the identifier has been assigned to an account, otherwise false.

ExternalResource.description: An external identifier assigned to a participant's account to allow external re-identification of the user by the study sponsor.

category.description: One of an enumerated list of categories of documentation resources.

url.description: The link to retrieve the resource via the Internet.

format.description: The format of the resource being described, expressed as a MIME type (e.g. "text/html" or "application/pdf").

date.description: The date of publication of the resource (a human-readable format is sufficient unless you wish to sort by this field).

description.description: Short description of the resource this link is documenting.

contributors.description: Non-authorial contributors to the documentation (researchers who participated in the research, grant funders, or the like).

publishers.description: A list of the publishers (or institutions, or even hosting sites) supporting publication of the documentation.

language.description: The language *of the resource being described by this link.* It is probably not necessary to use something structured like ISO 639-1 language codes, the name of the language in English will do.

minRevision.description: The earlist (lowest) revision of an assessment that this resource applies to. This value indicates that a resource was added to describe a development in the evolution of the assessment, or some other change to the assessment. For release notes about one specific revision of the assessment, minRevision can equal maxRevision.

maxRevision.description: The least (highest) revision of an assessment that this resource applies to. This deprecates the associated resource while keeping the link for reference. For release notes about one specific revision of the assessment, minRevision can equal maxRevision.

createdAtRevision.description: The revision of the assessment at the time this resource was created or updated. Used to determine if the resource may be out-of-date.

createdOn.description: The date and time the app config was created.

modifiedOn.description: The date and time the app config was last modified.

deleted.description: Has this external resource been logically deleted (an admin can restore it)?

version.description: The optimistic locking version of the assessment. This value must be submitted as part of the next update of the model. If it does not match the value on the server, a 409 error (Conflict) will prevent the update from occurring. It can also serve as a key to determine if a local cache of `Assessment` needs to be updated.

upToDate.description: The `createdAtRevision` field records the revision of the assessment when this resource link was created or last updated. If that value is equal to the most recent (highest) revision of the assessment, `upToDate` will be true. Otherwise it will be false. This can help flag resources that may no longer be relevant for the assessment.

FileReference.description: A pointer to a file revision hosted for this app.

createdOn.description: The createdOn timestamp of the file revision

href.description: An URL to retrieve the file revision

externalId.description: The external ID for which a password is being generated.

userId.description: The user ID of the account for which a password has been generated. The user ID will be returned whether this call created an account for the external ID, or whether the account already existed.

password.description: A randomly generated password. This password will pass your app's password validation constraints, unless you change these after creating the password. **This password should not be generated off the device this study participant will use to access the study.**

GuidCreatedOnVersionHolder.description: An object that describes the keys and optimistic lock values of a Survey. This object is returned from create and update endpoints rather than an entire survey.

guid.description: The guid of the survey (added when the survey is created).

createdOn.description: The createdOn value of the survey (added when survey is created).

version.description: The optimistic locking version of the survey. This value must be submitted as part of the next update of the model. If it does not match the value on the server, a 409 error (Conflict) will prevent the update from occurring.

GuidHolder.description: An object that provides the GUID for a newly created entity. This object is returned from create and update endpoints rather than an entire entity.

guid.description: The guid of the newly created entity.

GuidVersionHolder.description: An object that describes the keys and optimistic lock values of an entity (e.g. a Subpopulation or SchedulePlan). This object is returned from create and update endpoints rather than an entire entity.

guid.description: The guid of the entity (added when the entity is created).

version.description: The optimistic locking version of the survey. This value must be submitted as part of the next update of the model. If it does not match the value on the server, a 409 error (Conflict) will prevent the update from occurring.

HealthDataDocumentation.description: The documentation to be associated with participant health data.

identifier.description: The unique identifier of the documentation.

version.description: A version number used for optimistic locking of the object these keys represent; this value must be passed back to the server on updates. If the version doesn't match the version in the database, an error will be returned (409 Conflict) and the documntation will not be saved.

documentation.description: The documentation, which is limited to a maximum size of 100 K.

createdBy.description: The userId of the author of the documentation.

createdOn.description: The date time of creation of the documentation.

modifiedBy.description: The userId of the user who modified the documentation.

modifiedOn.description: The date time of the modification of the documentation.

HealthDataRecord.description: See [Bridge Upload Data Format](/articles/study_design/upload_data_format.html) for details about this model object. Only researchers and administrators can retrieve this full record through an upload record in the API.

appVersion.description: App version, as reported by the app. Generally in the form "version 1.0.0, build 2". Must be 48 chars or less.

createdOn.description: ISO timestamp of when the data record was created, as reported by the submitting app

createdOnTimeZone.description: The original timezone of the createdOn timestamp, expressed as a 4-digit string with sign. For example, -0800, +0900

data.description: JSON map with key value pairs representing the record's data.

dayInStudy.description:
How many calendar days the participant has been in the study. For example, if the participant started on |
2019-07-24, then 2019-07-24 is day 1, 2019-07-25 is day 2, etc. Calendar days are calculated using the |
same timezone as the Bridge Exporter (ie, America/Los_Angeles).

id.description: A unique GUID for this record.

metadata.description: Arbitrary JSON blob of record metadata, as submitted by the app. For ResearchKit-based apps, this is info.json verbatim.

phoneInfo.description: Phone info, for example "iPhone9,3" or "iPhone 5c (GSM)". Must be 48 chars or less.

rawDataAttachmentId.description: Attachment ID (S3 key) that contains the raw data. This is the unencrypted zip file for uploads, or JSON blob for directly submitted records

appId.description: App that this record lives in.

uploadDate.description: Calendar date in YYYY-MM-DD format representing when the server received the upload, using the server's local time zone (US Pacific timezone).

uploadId.description: The upload GUID of the upload this record is processed from.

uploadedOn.description: The date and time of the upload.

userMetadata.description: JSON map with key value pairs representing metadata for this health data record, as submitted by the app. This corresponds with the uploadMetadataFieldDefinitions configured in the study.

userSharingScope.description: The user's sharing scope at the time of this upload's submission.

userExternalId.description: The user's external ID at the time of this upload's submission.

userDataGroups.description: The user's data groups at the time of this upload's submission.

userStudyMemberships.description:
A map where the keys are the study IDs assigned to the user at the time that user generated this 
health data, and the values are the external IDs that were assigned to the user for each study (if no external ID was assigned, the value will be an empty string).

validationErrors.description: Error messages related to upload validation. Only generated if UploadValidationStrictness is set to REPORT.

version.description: A version number issued for optimistic locking of record updates. Should not be set when creating a new health data record. When updating a record retrieved from the API, the object will have the version attribute and this must match the last value issued by the service or an update will fail.

HealthDataRecordEx3.description:
Represents the Health Data Record model for Exporter 3. This is not cross-compatible with the original model for
Health Data Records.

id.description: Record ID, uniquely identifies this record.

appId.description: App that the record belongs to.

studyId.description: Study that the record belongs to. May be null if the record is not part of a study.

healthCode.description: Health code of the participant that submitted the record.

createdOn.description: ISO timestamp of when this record was submitted to Bridge.

clientInfo.description: Client info string of the participant at the time they submitted the record to Bridge.

exported.description: This is set to true when the record is exported to Synapse.

exportedOn.description: ISO timestamp of when this record was exported to Synapse. Due to redrives and re-exports, this may be different than createdOn.

metadata.description: Client-submitted metadata, as a map of key-value pairs.

version.description:
A version number issued for optimistic locking of record updates. Should not be set when creating a new
health data record. When updating a record retrieved from the API, the object will have the version
attribute and this must match the last value issued by the service or an update will fail.

HealthDataSubmission.description: Used to submit health data to the synchronous health data API.

appVersion.description: App version, as reported by the app. Generally in the form "version 1.0.0, build 2". Must be 48 chars or less.

createdOn.description: ISO timestamp of when the data record was created, as reported by the submitting app

data.description: JSON map with key value pairs representing the record's data.

metadata.description: JSON map with key value pairs representing metadata for this health data record, as submitted by the app. This corresponds with the uploadMetadataFieldDefinitions configured in the app.

phoneInfo.description: Phone info, for example "iPhone9,3" or "iPhone 5c (GSM)". Must be 48 chars or less.

surveyCreatedOn.description: If the health data is a survey response, this is the createdOn timestamp that specifies the survey version. The timestamp is in ISO8601 format.

surveyGuid.description: If the health data is a survey response, this is the GUID that specifies the survey.

FileMetadata.description: A descriptor of a static file resource (image, XML file, video file, etc.) that is hosted via the Bridge server

disposition.description: When served by the host server, files can be sent with a `Content-Disposition` header that indicates to web clients how the file should be displayed. By default this value is set to `attachment` which indicates the file should be downloaded to local storage; `inline` indicates the file will be embedded in a web page (most commonly used for images).

createdOn.description: The date and time the account was created.

modifiedOn.description: The date and time the account was last modified.

deleted.description: Has this file been logically deleted (an admin can restore it)?

version.description: The optimistic locking version of the file metadata. This value must be submitted as part of the next update of the model. If it does not match the value on the server, a 409 error (Conflict) will prevent the update from occurring. It can also serve as a key to determine if a local cache of this `File` revision needs to be updated.

FileRevision.description: An object that tracks the existence of an individual revision of a file resource in S3.

mimeType.description: The MIME type of this file.

createdOn.description: The date and time the account was created.

size.description: The size of the file in bytes.

Identifier.description: Payload object for an email address or phone number. You do not provide both identifiers when using this object for a call.

appId.description: String identifier if the participant's app.

IdentifierHolder.description: An object that holds an identifier for a created entity.

identifier.description: The identifier of the entity (added when the entity is created).

IdentifierUpdate.description: An update to the key identifier fields of an account (email, phone number, external ID or Synapse user ID). To update these fields, the caller must submit authentication credentials, either sign in credentials or the reauthToken that was sent on sign in. This is to prevent the account from being hijacked through the hijacking of a user's session token.

emailUpdate.description: An email address to add to the account. Will only be added if the account does not already have an email address.

phoneUpdate.description: A phone number to add to the account. Will only be added if the account does not already have a phone number.

synapseUserIdUpdate.description: A synapse user ID (a number expressed as a string) to add to the account.

source.description: An URL to an image. It is strongly recommended that the image be an SVG (vector graphics, re-scalable to the target device's screen size and resolution), **or** at least 600 by 400 pixels in size, if not larger (some phones have screens of up to 800 or more pixels across the screen).

width.description: The width of the image in pixels. If image is present, this field is required.

height.description: The height of the image in pixels. If image is present, this field is required.

IntentToParticipate.description: For studies that wish to orchestrate an agreement to participate prior to signing up for a study, this API provides a way to store a consent under a phone number or email address. The user must submit a phone number *or* an email address (not both) as part of this submission, the same credential that will be used to sign up for the study. On first sign in, instead of receiving a 412 response, this user will be consented with this intent to participate record.

appId.description: The identifier for the app in which the user consents to participate.

subpopGuid.description: The specific subpopulation sent in the study to which the user consents to participate.

osName.description: The operating system name under which the install link can be retrieved. OS name is not required, and in that event, an install link under the key "Universal" will be sent to the user.

InvalidEntity.description: Payload returned with a 400 error when an entity submitted to the server is invalid.

message.description: A message that will include all validation error messages for this object.

Label.description: A localizable string value to show study participants.

lang.description: A valid ISO 639 alpha-2 or alpha-3 language code specifying the language of the label.

MasterSchedulerConfig.description: Configurations to setup a report scheduler.

cronSchedule.description: Cron expression indicating when the schedule should be run.

requestTemplate.description: An arbitrary JSON object containing template for the request to be sent to the configured SQS queue.

sqsQueueUrl.description: SQS queue URL to send requests to

version.description: The optimistic locking version of the survey. This value must be submitted as part of the next update of the model. If it does not match the value on the server, a 409 error (Conflict) will prevent the update from occurring.

Notification.description: A notification to show to a participant as part of the execution of a scheduled session.

offset.description: The time after a window starts or before it ends (based on the `notifyAt` property) when a notification should be shown to the user.

interval.description: If a window lasts for more than twenty-four hours, a notification can be repeated on a daily repeat value. Only day values are allowed.

allowSnooze.description: Allow the participant to â€œsnoozeâ€ a notification or reminder (dismiss it with some amount of time before it occurs again). Cannot be true if `notifyAt` is null.

messages.description: The message to use for a notification. Only one message can be included for a given language. The system will first try and select the participantâ€™s preferred languages (from most to least preferred), then it will select an English (â€œenâ€) language default message. An English language default message *must* be provided because there is no other reasonable fallback value.

NotificationInfo.description: A notification to show to a participant as part of the execution of a scheduled session.

offset.description: The time after a window starts or before it ends (based on the `notifyAt` property) when a notification should be shown to the user.

interval.description: If a window lasts for more than twenty-four hours, a notification can be repeated on a daily repeat value. Only day values are allowed.

allowSnooze.description: Allow the participant to â€œsnoozeâ€ a notification or reminder (dismiss it with some amount of time before it occurs again). Cannot be true if `notifyAt` is null.

message.description: The message to use for a notification and reminder, if these have been specified. This message will be the message selected for the caller based on their language preferences.

lang.description: A valid ISO 639 alpha-2 or alpha-3 language code specifying the language of the notification.

subject.description: Very short rendition of the notification. For example, this value will be displayed on an Apple iWatch, where the message is shown for a short time only.

endpoint.description: The endpoint that should be registered for the notification. For "sms" protocol, this is the participant's verified phone number in string form. For "application" protocol, this is the endpointARN generated when the user's device is registered for a specific platform (using a platformARN).

deviceId.description: This should be either the device token retrieved from the iOS operation system, or the registrationId on Android.

osName.description: Information used to track which type of deviceId is being submitted. This string should be either "Android" or "iPhone OS" ("iOS" also works), and should match the operating system from which you retrieved a push notification identifier (deviceId).

createdOn.description: Date the client registered for push notifications with Bridge.

modifiedOn.description: The last time the registration was updated based on a new device identifier being issued by the client operating system (iOS or Android). If an updated registration is submitted but the deviceId has not changed, the record is not modified.

guid.description: A unique GUID for this topic

name.description: The name of this topic (visible to developers and researchers in design tools).

shortName.description: Short name for the topic, used as the display name for the topic in SNS. This also appears in SMS notifications. Must be 10 characters or less.

description.description: Description of the purpose of this topic (visible to developers and researchers in design tools).

createdOn.description: The date and time this topic was created.

modifiedOn.description: The date and time this topic was last modified.

criteria.description: If a topic has criteria, users can be automatically subscribed and unsubscribed when their criteria context changes.

expiresOn.description: The ISO 8601 timestamp of when this access token will expire.

providerUserId.description: The provider's ID for this user.

scopes.description: Scopes attached to the OAuth access token.

appId.description: The app the user is authenticating to (optional and used when authenticating with Brige via an OAuth server, currently only Synapse).

vendorId.description: The OAuth service vendor through which the user is authenticating (currently the only supported vendor is "synapse");

authToken.description: The OAuth 2.0 authorization token returned from the provider, which must be submitted to the Bridge server in order to retrieve an access token. This token is optional, but if provided, Bridge server will always renew the access token with the OAuth provider.

callbackUrl.description: The callback URL registered with the OAuth authentication server. This must match the value that was initially sent to the server and was used to redirect back to the Bridge client.

clientId.description: The client ID of the app.

secret.description: The secret token that the server must provide.

endpoint.description: The URL to send an authorization token to to retrieve access and refresh tokens.

callbackUrl.description: The callback URL that the client provides to retrieve the authorization token. This must match that callback URL exactly.

introspectEndpoint.description:
OAuth introspect URL, as defined by RFC7662. Optional but recommended. Note that we currently use these |
for scopes, and FitBit uses a non-standard format. See FitBit OAuth documentation for details.

identifier.description: An identifier for this organization (supplied by the user and unique in the scope of this app).

createdOn.description: The date and time this organization was created.

modifiedOn.description: The date and time this organization was last modified.

version.description: The optimistic locking version of the organization. This value must be submitted as part of the next update of the model. If it does not match the value on the server, a 409 error (Conflict) will prevent the update from occurring. It can also serve as a key to determine if a local cache of this `Organization` revision needs to be updated.

ParticipantData.description: The JSON data for a non-time series participant data attribute.

identifier.description: The identifier of the participant data.

data.description: A string containing the data to be saved for the participant data attribute.

ParticipantFile.description: A descriptor of a participant blob file

expiresOn.description: The time when the downloadUrl or uploadUrl expires.

ParticipantRosterRequest.description: The JSON data for a participant roster download request.

studyId.description: The studyId to filter the participant roster by.

ParticipantVersion.description:
Represents a de-identified snapshot of a study participant at a moment in time. This is used by Exporter 3.0 to
generate the de-identified participant roster.

appId.description: App that the participant lives in.

participantVersion.description: Participant version. This is incremented every time the participant is updated and we create a new row.

createdOn.description: ISO timestamp of when any version of this participant was first created.

modifiedOn.description: ISO timestamp of when this participant was last updated (ie, when this participant version was created).

dataGroups.description: Data groups assigned to this participant.

languages.description:
Languages captured from a request by this user's Accept-Language header. This should be an ordered list of
unique ISO 639-1 language codes.

studyMemberships.description:
The studies assigned to the user, and the optional external ID being used for each assignment, if any. The
keys of this map are study IDs, and the values are either the associated external ID, or null if there is
no associated external ID.

When exporting to Synapse, if the project is study specific, the Exporter will only export that specific
study's external ID.

timeZone.description: Participant's time zone, as an IANA time zone name (eg "America/Los_Angeles").

PasswordPolicy.description: The rules to enforce on the creation of passwords for Bridge accounts.

minLength.description: The minimum number of characters that's required in the password.

numericRequired.description: Is at least one number required in the password? (0-9).

symbolRequired.description:
Is at least one ASCII symbol (non-letter, non-number) required in the 
password? (! " # $ % & ' ( ) * + , - . / : ; < = > ? @ [ \ ] ^ _ ` { Â¦ } ~).

lowerCaseRequired.description: Is at least one lower-case letter required? (a-z).

upperCaseRequired.description: Is at least one upper-case letter required? (A-Z).

PasswordReset.description: Payload to send a new password to the Bridge server.

sptoken.description: This is a one-time use token issued to the user to change his or her password. Normally this is emailed to the user's email account, using a link back to the Bridge web interface where it is extracted to complete this API call.

number.description: The phone number (can be formatted in any way that's useful for end users).

regionCode.description: CLDR two-letter region code describing the region in which the phone number was issued.

nationalFormat.description: The phone number formatted in the commonly accepted national format of the region code. This value is read-only.

PhoneSignInRequest.description: Make a request to sign in using an SMS message. This request will trigger a message to be sent to an existing account's phone number. The SMS message will include a numeric token that must be included in a subsequent request to the server to authenticate.

appId.description: The identifier for the participant's app.

propName.description: The property name of the property on the JSON object that can be edited.

label.description: A short label for the property.

description.description: A longer description of the property and the allowable values that it can take.

propType.description: A type hint to a UI editor for this property. The value is not constrained to support complex types, but we suggest 'string', 'number', or 'boolean' as basic values to support with editing tools.

RecordExportStatusRequest.description: A payload sending back the status of an export of one or more health data records to Synapse. Used to trace the upload of data to the Synapse data repository.

ReportData.description:
The JSON data for one time point of a report (either a local date in the format YYYY-MM-DD, or an ISO 8601 timestamp; report records should all use one or the other format consistently).
The `date` property can be used to submit either a local date or timestamp, and the value will be returned in the `date` property as well as the `localDate` or `dateTime` property depending on the format. You can also alternative submit `localDate` or `dateTime` (but never both), and you'll get back the value in that property as well as the `date` property.
Data can be for a study as a whole, or a report on a single participant, depending on the endpoint that is used to persist the data in Bridge.

date.description: The date (whether local or an ISO timestamp) of the report data.

localDate.description: The date expressed as a LocalDate (YYYY-MM-DD)

dateTime.description: The date expressed as an ISO 8601 timestamp.

data.description: An arbitrary JSON object containing whatever data should be saved for a report.

studyIds.description: The studies this report record is associated to (these are set with the first record that is submitted and that creates a report index, and cannot be changed afterward unless the user is a study-wide user not associated to any specific study.

ReportDataForWorker.description: The JSON data to submit a report record for a point in time (curently a day expressed in the format YYYY-MM-DD). This object includes a healthCode because worker processes, as they produce records for a participant report, may be working from anonymized data.

healthCode.description: The health code of the person for whom this data is being created.

date.description: The date (YYYY-MM-DD) of the report data.

dateTime.description: The date expressed as an ISO 8601 timestamp.

data.description: An arbitrary JSON object containing whatever data should be saved for a report.

studyIds.description: The studies this report record is associated to (these are set with the first record that is submitted and that creates a report index, and cannot be changed afterward unless the user is an app-wide user not associated to any specific study.

ReportIndex.description:
An identifier to retrieve a series of report data (e.g. "three-week-report"). A separate list of these 
are maintained for study and participant reports.

studyIds.description: The studies these report records are associated to.

public.description: Study reports can be marked as "public", which will make them accessible through the API to any requester (authentication is not required).

RequestInfo.description:
Some basic information is captured when a participant makes a request to the Bridge server, mostly for the purpose of troubleshooting user issues with the app. Questions that can be answered include:

* what version of the app is this participant using?
* what filtering criteria might be applied to their requests?
* when was the last time they uploaded data or retrieved activities?
* do they have a session right now, or have they contacted the server recently at all?

This information is cached but not persisted; it is not guaranteed to be present for all active users.

clientInfo.description: The `User-Agent` string from the last request as parsed for the purpose of applying filtering criteria.

userAgent.description: The `User-Agent` header exactly as it was sent to the server, whether it is parseable by the Bridge server or not.

languages.description: The language or languages sent in the user's `Accept-Language` header and persisted as part of the participant's account configuration, as they were set at the time of the last request.

userDataGroups.description: The data groups assigned to this participant at the time of the last request.

activitiesAccessedOn.description: The last recorded time the participant's application requested scheduled activities from the server.

timelineAccessedOn.description: The last recorded time the participant's application requested timeline information (either the timeline or the recent study activity events) from the server.

signedInOn.description: The last recorded time the participant signed in to the server.

uploadedOn.description: The last recorded time the participant started an upload to the server.

timeZone.description: The user's time zone at the time of the last request.

RequestParams.description: Type-safe object that returns request parameters submitted for a request. Only the values that are submitted in a request, or that are assigned default values by the server, will be returned with the response. Inapplicable values will be null.

Schedule.description: For more information about scheduling, see [Scheduling](/articles/study_design/scheduling.html).

label.description: A label to describe this schedule.

eventId.description: A comma-separated list of event IDs against which will be used for scheduling. If no eventId is provided, the event `enrollment` will be used. The system will use the first event ID (working left to right) for which the user has an event with a timestamp.

delay.description: ISO 8601 duration string. An amount of time to wait before scheduling the first task.

interval.description: An ISO 8601 duration, describing the period in days between tasks (it can be days, weeks, months or even years, but should not be smaller than a day). If this is used, cronTrigger should not be used.

sequencePeriod.description: A recurring schedule can specify a sequence in a crossover study design. The sequence starts from the triggering event, plus any delay, and continues until the end of the period. For example, if you have a recurring schedule that repeats daily, a `sequencePeriod` of 1 day (P1D) would generate one activity. If you set `sequencePeriod` to P2D, you will get two activities. Note that this is true regardless of whether or not there is a delay. Washout periods between sequences can be specified by delaying the execution of the next sequence.

expires.description: ISO 8601 duration string. The period of time after which an unstarted, scheduled activity should be removed from the application (if it has not been started, no data will have been saved on the server). This is mandatory for recurring schedules so that unstarted activities do not stack up in the user's UI.

cronTrigger.description: A cron expression will schedule recurring tasks according to this standard syntax for describing event schedules from the Unix operating system. The format of the cron expression is the seven field format as described in the documentation for the Java Quartz Scheduler (note that there are other formats that take up to eleven fields, this online cron expression generator creates expressions in the right format). If this is used, the interval and times are ignored.

startsOn.description: The scheduler will not create a task before this date and time.

endsOn.description: The scheduler will not create a task after this date and time. **Note that this takes precedence over the minimumPerSchedule setting that can be provided via the API. Tasks will not be "topped up" to this minimum if they extend outside of this time window.**

times.description: Required if an interval is specified (ignored if a cron expression is specified). An array of one or more ISO 8601 time values (without a date or time zone, e.g. "14:00"). One task will be created for each time on the day determined by the rest of the scheduler. If the schedule occurs once, only the first time will be used to schedule the task (and if no time is provided, the original time of the triggering event will be used; it's clearest to set a time).

items.description: 24hr time value(s) without a time zone (e.g. "14:30"). **Each time value will create a separate task, one for each activity in the schedule.**

persistent.description: True if schedule type is persistent. (This is here for legacy reasons.)

activities.description: One or more activities that should be done by a participant on this schedule. Each activity will generate a separate task. See Activity.

Schedule2.description: A design-time representation of a schedule for participants to perform (for the v2 of our scheduling API).

ownerId.description: The identifier of the organization that owns this schedule.

name.description: The name of the schedule as shown to a study designer.

guid.description: The unique identifier for this model.

duration.description: The length of time this schedule will run for. Only day and week values are allowed (although these can be mixed).

published.description: Has this schedule been published? Mo further changes can be made to the schedule after publication.

deleted.description: Has this schedule been logically deleted? An admin can restore it.

clientData.description: Client data for a schedule should be in a syntactically valid JSON format. It will be returned as is to the client (as JSON). It can contain any information that is useful to authoring tools or administration tools that is not part of the Bridge data model.

createdOn.description: The date and time the schedule was created.

modifiedOn.description: The date and time the schedule was last modified.

version.description: The optimistic locking version of the schedule. This value must be submitted as part of the next update of the model. If it does not match the value on the server, a 409 error (Conflict) will prevent the update from occurring.

ScheduleCriteria.description: In a [CriteriaScheduleStrategy](#CriteriaScheduleStrategy), a list of ScheduleCriteria objects relate each schedule to a set of criteria that needs to match the user's request in order to select that schedule for the user.

ScheduledAssessment.description: The `refKey` of this object will refer to the `key` value of an AssessmentInfo object in the assessments of the timeline. The `instanceGuid` is a unique GUID to identify any data that is generated from the execution of this scheduled assessment. This allows scientists to contextualize data based on when it was gathered in the execution of the studyâ€™s schedule.

ScheduledSession.description: An individual session instance the participant should perform as part of the study. The `refGuid` property will refer to a session in the list of sessions in this timeline. The `instanceGuid` is a unique GUID to identify any data that is generated from the execution of this scheduled session. This allows scientists to contextualize data based on when it was gathered in the execution of the studyâ€™s schedule. Further details about how a client should interpret a timeline can be found at the Bridge developer portal.

startEventId.description: An event ID for this scheduled session. The event ID may be mapped to a timestamp for a user. If the event ID does not exist for the user, the client should ignore this scheduled session. Otherwise, it should be shown to the user according to the scheduling information.

startTime.format: ISO 8601 Local Time, hours and minutes only

SchedulePlan.description: A schedule plan relates schedules to some specific strategies for using these schedules to create activities for participants.

label.description: The name of this schedule plan (not shown to users).

version.description: The optimistic locking version of the survey. This value must be submitted as part of the next update of the model. If it does not match the value on the server, a 409 error (Conflict) will prevent the update from occurring.

ScheduleStrategy.description: This is an interface for several implementations. See [scheduling](/articles/scheduling.html) for further information on creating schedules.

ScheduledActivity.description: Description of an activity (such as a task or survey) the study would like the participant to perform. A scheduled activity will contain a reference to a task, a survey, a compound task (which can include any combination of tasks and surveys), and the activityType will reflect which property exists on the scheduled activity object (e.g. if a task is defined, the activityType will be "task").

startedOn.description: This field is filled out by the client to persist the fact that a task has been started. Started on is always reported in UTC, regardless of the time zone being used to express the scheduling window (scheduledOn to expiresOn).

finishedOn.description: This field is filled out by the client to persist the fact that a task has been finished. To delete a task, record a finishedOn timestamp and leave the startedOn field blank. Finished on is always reported in UTC, regardless of the time zone being used to express the scheduling window (scheduledOn to expiresOn).

scheduledOn.description: The time at which the activity should be made available to the participant. It's fine to show the activity before this, but the user should not be able to start it until this time has passed. Time will be expressed in the time zone sent to the server to request the scheduled activities.

expiresOn.description: The time after which this task should no longer be made available to the participant. It will also no longer be returned from the server API. Time will be expressed in the time zone sent to the server to request the scheduled activities.

persistent.description: Is this activity persistent? If so, it will never be removed from the list of activities; the client may wish to provide different UI for such a task.

clientData.description:
An arbitrary object that will be serialized and stored as JSON using the GSON serialization mechanisms. In Java this field is an Object; since the type of the object is not known, the rest-client includes a utility method:
```
MyCustomObject data = RestUtils.toType(
    activity.getClientData(), MyCustomObject.class);
```

SchemaReference.description: A pointer to an upload schema defined for this survey. This schema represents a particular task or activity that the participant should perform, and tells the app which schema ID and revision number to associate the data upload with. If the revision number is set to null when creating a schedule plan, then the reference is to the most recent revision for the given OS and app version. The specific revision number that should be used will be resolved when a [ScheduledActivity](#ScheduledActivity) is created for the participant).

revision.description: Schema revision number. Can be blank in a Schedule Plan if you want the Scheduler to automatically resolve to the latest revision for the user's app version.

Session.description: A group of activities to be performed together in a study by a participant. The session can describe a repeating sequence that can repeat up to the length of a schedule.

guid.description: The unique identifier for this model.

name.description: A required name for this session that will be shown to schedule authors, and can be used as a label for participants if no label can be found.

symbol.description: A unicode symbol or token identifier (32 characters or less) for a compact/symbolic representation of the session in UI tools.

labels.description: A collection of labels for this schedule. Only one label can be included for a given language. The system will first try and select the participantâ€™s preferred languages (from most to least preferred), then it will select an English (â€œenâ€) language default message. If an English label does not exist in the list of labels, then the schedule name will be used as a label.

startEventIds.description: One or more event IDs, either system defined or custom-defined for the study. If they are custom events, prepend them with the "custom:" string (this is not absolutely necessary, but if your custom event ID ever conflicts with a system ID, it will be interpreted as a system ID). If the event ID does not exist in the map of event to timestamp IDs for a participant, this session and the series of scheduled assessments to perform should be ignored. A session must declare at least one start event or study burst ID.

studyBurstIds.description: One or more study bursts that can generate events that should trigger the scheduling of this session. If the study burst has not fired, then the events it creates will not exist, so they will not be in the map of event to timestamp IDs for a participant; this session and the series of scheduled assessments to perform should be ignored. A session must declare at least one start event or study burst ID.

delay.description: A period of time after the start event timestamp before the session should be presented to the participant. Only minute, hour, day, and week values are allowed (although these can be mixed).

interval.description: After the start time of the first session (which is measured from an event timestamp plus the delay period), a period of time before the session should be presented to the participant again. Note that this interval is separate from the time window start and expiration. Only day and week values are allowed (although these can be mixed). The expiration period of a time window cannot be longer in duration than the interval of the session itself.

occurrences.description: If the session has an interval, the user should perform the session until the end of the scheduleâ€™s duration, *unless* a smaller number of repetitions is specified via `occurrences`.

assessments.description: A collection of assessment references. When creating a schedule, default values from an assessment can be used to populate these reference objects, which can then be changed by the study designer. *Therefore if an assessment is changed, the values will not be updated in the schedule.*

notifications.description: A collection of notifications to show around the execution of a session window.

SessionInfo.description: Information about a session in order to render it in a UI prior to execution.

guid.description: The unique identifier for this model.

label.description: A required name for this session that will be shown to schedule authors, and can be used as a label for participants if no label can be found.

symbol.description: A unicode symbol or token identifier (32 characters or less) for a compact/symbolic representation of a session in UI tools.

timeWindowGuids.description: A list of all the time window GUIDs for this session. The number of time windows in a session can be useful information for some UI grouping tasks.

SharedModuleImportStatus.description: This struct contains the results of importing a shared module into the local app, including what type of module it is, and its key params (schema ID/revision or survey GUID/createdOn) in the local app.

schemaId.description: Schema ID, if this module is a schema.

schemaRevision.description: Schema revision, if this module is a schema.

surveyCreatedOn.description: Survey created-on timestamp (as an ISO8601 timestamp), if this module is a survey.

surveyGuid.description: Survey GUID, if this module is a survey.

SharedModuleMetadata.description: Metadata for shared modules in the shared module library.

licenseRestricted.description: True if usage of this module is restricted by license or copyright.

notes.description: User-friendly descriptive notes for the module.

os.description: Which OS (iOS, Android, etc) this module applies to, if the module is OS-specific.

published.description: Flag that marks the module as published. A published module versions cannot be modified. However, another version of the same module can be created for continued editing.

schemaId.description: Schema ID, if this module is a schema.

schemaRevision.description: Schema revision, if this module is a schema.

surveyCreatedOn.description: Survey created-on timestamp (as an ISO8601 timestamp), if this module is a survey.

surveyGuid.description: Survey GUID, if this module is a survey.

tags.description: An unordered list of tags, used for querying and filtering.

deleted.description: Has this shared module metadata been logically deleted (an admin can restore it)?

version.description: Module version.

SignIn.description: Information to sign in to the Bridge server. For a successful sign in, this object must include an *identifier* (either email or phone number) and a *secret* (either password or a reauthToken). Depending on the credentials supplied, there are currently different server endpoints to call. The appId is always required.

appId.description: App identifier of the participant's app

externalId.description: The external ID associated with this app participant

reauthToken.description: The token sent with a new session to reauthenticate with the server. This removes the need for a client app to store the user's password. The reauth token is rotated each time the caller authenticates or reauthenticates.

SignUp.description: The information necessary to sign up for a Bridge app. **Only the app's ID, an email address, and a password are required to sign up for an app.** However, all the information of [AbstractStudyParticipant](#AbstractStudyParticipant) can be submitted at sign up. In some configurations of the server, for example, an `externalId` value must be submitted at the time of sign up.

appId.description: The app ID of the app the participant is joining.

email.description: The user's email. Users can use the same email for different studies, but their account is identified by the email within an app.

externalId.description: An externally-assignable identifier a research partner can use to re-identify a user's data in the exported data set (this must be provided by the application, it is not created by Bridge). The value can be set on creation or added on an account update, but it will be returned in the `externalIds` mapping which specifies the study within which the external ID was defined. This field will be null when retrieved from the server.

consent.description: **Create user API for admins only.** Create this user consented to all required consents. For testing purposes only.

SimpleScheduleStrategy.description: The SimpleScheduleStrategy uses the same schedule for every participant. It is the easiest way to schedule activities and is a good place to start when building a schedule.

SmsMessage.description: Represents an SMS message that we sent to a phone number.

phoneNumber.description: The phone number receiving this message, formatted in E.164 international format.

sentOn.description: Timestamp in ISO8601 format when we sent the message.

healthCode.description: Health code of the participant that received the message, if the participant had an account at the time the message was sent.

messageId.description: Message ID, as determined by the SMS provider.

appId.description: The app whose behalf we sent the message.

SmsTemplate.description:
A template for one of the system SMS messages sent by Bridge. This message, after template variable values are interpolated into the string, cannot be more than 160 characters in length. In the templates, variable strings can be used to interpolate the following values:

**All templates**

|Template Variable|What it will be replaced with|
|---|---|
|appName|The full name of the app|
|appShortName|The short name of the app (ten letters or less)|
|appId|The identifier of the app|
|sponsorName|The name of the app sponsor|
|supportEmail|The support email of the app|
|technicalEmail|The technical support email of the app|
|consentEmail|The consent administration email of the app|
|host|The host server (e.g. `https://ws.sagebridge.org`|

**Account exists SMS message**
*You can include a link to reset the account's password, or a token to sign in via the SMS message, if supported by the app, or both.*

|Template Variable|What it will be replaced with|
|---|---|
|resetPasswordUrl|The URL that must be loaded in a web browser to enter a new password|
|resetPasswordExpirationPeriod|The period (e.g. "2 hours") until the link expires|
|token|The token that must be captured and sent back to the server to sign in|
|phoneSignInExpirationPeriod|The period (e.g. "2 hours") until the token expires|
|sptoken|The token to send back to the server to validate a legitimate password reset (also included in links)|

**Password reset SMS message**
*${resetPasswordUrl} is required to be in the template.*

|Template Variable|What it will be replaced with|
|---|---|
|resetPasswordUrl|The URL that must be loaded in a web browser to enter a new password|
|resetPasswordExpirationPeriod|The period (e.g. "2 hours") until the link expires|
|sptoken|The token to send back to the server to validate a legitimate password reset (also included in links)|

**Sign in SMS message**
*${token} is required to be in the template.*

|Template Variable|What it will be replaced with|
|---|---|
|token|The token that must be captured and sent back to the server to sign in|
|phoneSignInExpirationPeriod|The period (e.g. "2 hours") until the token expires|

**Phone number verification SMS message**
*${token} is required to be in the template.*

|Template Variable|What it will be replaced with|
|---|---|
|token|The token that must be captured and sent back to validate a phone number|
|phoneVerificationExpirationPeriod|The period (e.g. "2 hours") until the token expires|

**Install app SMS message**
*${appInstallUrl} is required to be in the template.*

|Template Variable|What it will be replaced with|
|---|---|
|appInstallUrl|The URL selected for this request and returned as the link to download and install the app for this app|

message.description: The message to send (only text and template variables allowed).

StudyActivityEventRequest.description: Request object for creating a Custom Activity Event.

timestamp.description: ISO 8601 date and time to record for event

answerValue.description: Some event types can be scoped to a specific answer from the participant (in particular, survey questions). Ideally, answers are constrained to a known list of values so they can be targeted for scheduling.

clientTimeZone.description: An IANA Time Zone Database (TZDB) name for the participantâ€™s time zone at the time the record is submitted. If present, this field will be validated to be a valid time zone name.

StudyBurst.description: The description of a repeating burst of events, against which a study can schedule repeating sets of activities. A study burst is triggered by an `originEventId`, it then occurs at an `interval` period of time after that event for a specific number of `occurrences`. For example, a study burst of "foo" that is triggered by the `timeline_retrieved` event, with an interval of "P1W" and an occurrence of 3 would generate three events: `study_burst:foo:01` (a week after the `timeline_retrieved` event), `study_burst:foo:02` (two weeks after `timeline_retrieved` event), and `study_burst:foo:03` (three weeks after the `timeline_retrieved` event).

identifier.description: Identifier for the study burst. May contain any characters except a colon.

originEventId.description: The event ID that will trigger the generation of a set of study burst events

delay.description: ISO 8601 duration between the origin event timestamp and the first burst in the study burst sequence (days or weeks)

interval.description: ISO 8601 duration between the burst event timestamps in days or weeks

occurrences.description: The number of timestamps that should be generated with the `originEventId` occurs.

StudyBurstInfo.description: Information about a study burst from which some of the timeline is being derived.

delay.description: ISO 8601 duration between the origin event timestamp and the first burst in the study burst sequence (days or weeks)

interval.description: ISO 8601 duration between the burst event timestamps in days or weeks

occurrences.description: The number of timestamps that should be generated with the `originEventId` occurs.

StudyConsent.description:
For historical reasons, a revision of a consent document is known as a "study consent" (it would more accurate to call it a "subpopulation consent"). It is a revision of the consent document that is associated with a subpopulation.

Subpopulations can be used to group users for several purposes, but the most important use of subpopulations is to divide users into different *consent groups.* 

**Note:** calls that return lists of these study consents do not populate the `documentContent` property. You must retrieve an individual study consent to get the content of the consent.

subpopulationGuid.description: The guid of the subpopulation to which this consent belongs.

createdOn.description: The time the document was created on the server. Each update of the consent document creates a new revision at a new `createdOn` timestamp.

documentContent.description:
A valid XHTML document describing the consent. In this document, the following tokens can be inserted and they will be substituted with the user's consent information when the consent is requested for that user:

|Template variable|Substituted with|
|---|---|
|${appName}|The name of the app|
|${appShortName}||
|${supportEmail}|The support email address for the app|
|${technicalEmail}|The technical contact/support email address for the app|
|${sponsorName}|The name of the sponsor for this app (the institution or research team name)|
|${participantFirstName}|The participantâ€™s first name|
|${participantLastName}|The participantâ€™s last name|
|${participantEmail}|The participantâ€™s email address|
|${participantPhone}|The participantâ€™s phone number in E.164 format (e.g. â€œ+16175551212â€)|
|${participantPhoneRegion}|The participantâ€™s phone number region code (e.g. â€œUSâ€)|
