|${participantPhoneNationalFormat}|The participantâ€™s phone number in a regional format (e.g. â€œ(617) 555-1212â€)|

The signature block will be appended to the end of your consent document. **It is not possible to remove or change the signature block at this time.**

allOf.description: The full record about a study participant.

healthCode.description: Only included in studies that have been configured to return the health code, and only to researchers through the researcher APIs.

consentHistories.description: A complete historical record of all the user's consents and withdrawals of consent for all studies in the app.

enrollments.description: Records of every enrollment (whether withdrawn or not) in every study for this participant. The key of this mapping is the studyId, and the value is the record of the enrollment.

consented.description: True if the user has consented to all required consents, based on the user's most recent request info (client info, languages, data groups). May be null if this object was not constructed with consent histories, or if consent status is indeterminate.

timeZone.description: User's original time zone, as measured by the timezone used to request activities, as a string offset in ISO8601 format. Related to the v3 scheduling API, it is not always set or reliable.

guid.description: A unique auto-generated identifier for the subpopulation. Usually a GUID (but not always). Cannot be changed after creation. Used to retrieve the published consent for this subpopulation.

criteria.description: Optional selection criteria that can be used to determine if a user should be assigned to this subpopulation or not. If the user does not match a subpopulation, then that subpopulation and its requirements are invisible to that user. Otherwise the user is in the subpopulation and all its consent requirements apply.

autoSendConsentSuppressed.description: Should the user automatically be sent (via email or SMS) a copy of the consent when they sign it?

required.description: If true, participants must sign the consent associated with this subpopulation if they are identified as a member of this subpopulation. Users will receive a 412 response from Bridge if this condition is not met.

defaultGroup.description: If true, this is the default subpopulation created for an app, and it cannot be deleted (although it can be changed, and even made optional or hidden through the use of criteria).

publishedConsentCreatedOn.description: The creation date (ISO 8601 timestamp) of the version of the consent agreement for this subpopulation that is published, ie. that is presented to users for their signature. The subpopulation guid and this createdOn timestamp can be used to retrieve the consent document.

dataGroupsAssignedWhileConsented.description: The data groups that will be assigned to a participant who consents to membership in this subpopulation. If the participant withdraws from this subpopulation, the data groups will be removed from their account.

studyIdsAssignedOnConsent.description: The studies this participant is associated to when they consent to membership in this subpopulation. This association is permanent (even if the participant withdraws from the subpopulation, they are still part of the study, visible to study research administrations, and so forth).

version.description: The optimistic locking version of the survey. This value must be submitted as part of the next update of the model. If it does not match the value on the server, a 409 error (Conflict) will prevent the update from occurring.

consentHTML.description: The URL to retrieve an HTML version of the published and active version of the consent. This can be referenced in your mobile app, web site, etc. Publishing a new consent revision will update this document.

consentPDF.description: The URL to retrieve a PDF version of the published and active version of the consent. This can be referenced in your mobile app, web site, etc. Publishing a new consent revision will update this document.

topicGuids.description: The topics to which the caller should be subscribed. If a topic is not in this list, and the caller is currently subscribed to that topic, they will be unsubscribed from that topic.

SubscriptionStatus.description: A participant will receive one of these records for every topic in an app, indicating whether or not the participant is subscribed to that topic. The list of topics can be used to show the user a UI to change these subscriptions.

Study.description: A study (an outside organization providing participants for a study).

details.description: An in-depth description of this study for prospective participants, or to show participants after they have joined a study (the â€œaboutâ€ screen for the study).

phase.description: The lifecycle phase this study is in.

clientData.description: Client data for a study should be in a syntactically valid JSON format. It will be returned as is to the client (as JSON). It can contain any information that is useful to study authoring tools or administration tools that is not part of the Bridge data model.

studyTimeZone.description: The time zone of the study. Reports for this study (including adherence reporting) will be run by Bridge based on this time zone. Must be an IANA time zone name.

adherenceThresholdPercentage.description: If a participantâ€™s adherence percentage drops under the adherence threshold percentage, Bridge will take action (for example, send a message to administrators for follow-up).

irbName.description: The name of the IRB that approved the study or decided it was exempt from human subjects research guidelines. Optional, but can be used to identify one of several IRBs if more than one is included in the studyâ€™s contact information.

irbDecisionOn.description: Before the study can launch, it must be reviewed by your IRB and either be approved, or considered exempt from human subjects research guidelines.

irbExpiresOn.description: The last date that the IRBâ€™s review is considered up-to-date for this study.

irbProtocolName.description: The name of the protocol as it was submitted to the IRB for approval.

irbProtocolId.description: An identification number for the study that has been assigned by the IRB.

studyLogoUrl.description: An URL to a logo for the study.

institutionId.description: An identification number for the study that has been assigned by the sponsor or institution running the study.

scheduleGuid.description: The GUID of the schedule to use for this study. **NOTE: this is temporary, and will be replaced with a model of the study protocol that can include multiple arms in the study.**

keywords.description: Free text that can be used in searches to locate studies.

diseases.description: A list of the diseases that are the subject of this study.

studyDesignTypes.description: The type of study (e.g. observational, interventional, etc.).

deleted.description: Has this study been logically deleted (an admin can restore it)?

createdOn.description: The date and time the study was created.

modifiedOn.description: The date and time the study was last modified.

version.description: The optimistic locking version of the study. This value must be submitted as part of the next update of the model. If it does not match the value on the server, a 409 error (Conflict) will prevent the update from occurring. It can also serve as a key to determine if a local cache of this `Study` revision needs to be updated.

StudyActivityEvent.description: Activity event for a participant in a specific study, used for scheduling activities.

eventId.description: A string identifying this event. The event ID must be in a specific format based on the type of event (e.g. `study_burst:foo:02` or `custom:event1`).

answerValue.description: Answer value for a question event, or the iteration value for a study burst event.

timestamp.description: ISO 8601 date and time that the event occurred. This timestamp may be generated by the server for system events, or it may be submitted by a client, in which case it will be according to the clientâ€™s clock which may be skewed from the server or actual time. The `createdOn` field can help to identify such clients.

updateType.description: The update type is carried over to the specific event records for informational purposes.

clientTimeZone.description: An IANA Time Zone Database (TZDB) name for the participantâ€™s time zone at the time the record is submitted. If present, this field will be validated to be a valid time zone name. If this event is an origin event for a study burst, the client time zone will be copied into the study burst events that are generated.

originEventId.description: If this event is generated from a study burst, the originating event ID that triggers the study burst to occur. Available for tools to order events in UIs.

studyBurstId.description: If the event is generated from a study burst, the identifier of the study burst (note that this is also part of the value of the event ID itself).

periodFromOrigin.description: If the event is generated from a study burst, An ISO 8601 duration, describing the period after the originating eventâ€™s timestamp when this event has been scheduled to occur. This value increments with each study burst event in the sequence by the interval value of the study burst itself.

recordCount.description: The number of unique timestamp values that have been recorded for this event. This field is present in list views, but not when this individual event is retrieved from the server. Immutable events should only ever have one record, while mutable events (`future_only` and `mutable`) can have any number of historical values.

createdOn.description: ISO 8601 date and time that the user account was created.

StudyInfo.description: An abridged study object with information that is useful for displaying, selecting, and signing into the study.

details.description: An in-depth description of this study for prospective participants, or to show participants after they have joined a study (the â€œaboutâ€ screen for the study).

phase.description: The lifecycle phase this study is in.

studyLogoUrl.description: An URL to a logo for the study.

moduleId.description: Module ID, if this survey was imported from a shared module.

moduleVersion.description: Module version, if this survey was imported from a shared module.

name.description: The name of this survey. The name can be changed after creation, and should not appear in the UI.

identifier.description: A private name for the survey, only visible to researchers, used to identify the survey on export. It is recommended (but not required) that this identifier be unique for this survey type within this app.

published.description: True if this survey revision has been published, and is accessible to users through scheduling. More than one version of a survey may be published; it is most common to return the most recently published version to users.

schemaRevision.description: The corresponding schema revision that Bridge server uses to export survey answers to Synapse.

createdOn.description: The ISO 8601 date on which this version of this survey was created.

modifiedOn.description: The date and time when this version of the survey was last modified.

copyrightNotice.description: A copyright notice identifying the owners of the published work.

deleted.description: Has this survey been logically deleted (an admin can restore it)?

version.description: The version of this survey as used to implement optimistic locking. This must be passed back to the server on an update, unmodified, in order for the update to succeed. If the survey has been concurrently modified, the update will throw an error.

elements.description: An ordered collection of SurveyElement sub-types (in the order they will appear in the survey).

SurveyElement.description: A survey element (either an info screen or a question).

guid.description: A unique GUID for this element of the survey

beforeRules.description: Survey elements can include one or more rules about how to progress through the elements of a survey (e.g. skipping a question if the user has been assigned to a specific data group). These rules are evaluated before the current element and may prevent it from being displayed. See [Survey Rule](#SurveyRule) for more information.

afterRules.description: Survey elements can include one or more rules about how to progress through the elements of a survey (e.g. skipping some questions if they are not relevant to the participant, based on an answer to a question). These rules are evaluated after the user answers the current survey question. See [Survey Rule](#SurveyRule) for more information.

identifier.description: A unique and easy-to-remember identifier, assigned by a researcher, that is maintained through later versions of the survey.

SurveyInfoScreen.description: A screen of a survey that presents information to the user: instructions, a thank you message, copyright notice, or anything similar.

prompt.description: The main instructions or information text for the user

promptDetail.description: Further information on the instructions, displayed in a secondary manner to the prompt (smaller text, more button, etc.).

image.description: An optional Image element describing an image to show for this screen.

title.description: A title for this question. Although this is required, it may or may not be used in the interface.

promptDetail.description: Sub-question text that provides further instructions or clarifications on how to answer.

SurveyQuestionOption.description: For questions with a list of enumerated answers, this object represents one of those answers.

label.description: The text to show in the UI (must be plain text).

detail.description: Detail text shown in a de-emphasized way near the label in the UI (must be plain text).

value.description: The value to submit when this option is selected. The value is always a string, but should be convertible to the data type of the question's constraints. If no value is provided, than the label should be sent as the answer to the surver.

image.description: An optional Image element describing an image to show for this option. It should be shown along with the label (which will still be required).

exclusive.description: If this option is selected, deselect all other options in the question. This is used for a "none of the above" type option in multiple choice questions.

SurveyReference.description: A pointer to a survey defined for this app, and associated with a survey to be taken as part of the mobile application health study. If the `createdOn` value is null, then the reference is to the most recently published version of the survey (the specific version that should be used will be resolved when a [ScheduledActivity](#ScheduledActivity) is created for the participant).

createdOn.description: The createdOn timestamp of the version of the survey. This can be null, which indicates the most recently published version of the study should be used.

href.description: An URL to retrieve the survey.

value.description:
The answer submitted by the user to the question. This value will be tested against the 
rule expression (the value is always expressed as  a string, regardless of the 
question's data type). For example, a rule with value="10",  operator=eq, indicates that 
the survey rule expression will be true if the user's answer is equal to 10.

dataGroups.description: Some operators will test a set of data groups against the user's set of data groups. The operators `any` and `all` make a comparison of the sets in this property against the user's data groups.

skipTo.description: The property will reference an identifier for a question in the survey. If specified, and the rule's expression is true, stop evaluating survey rules and display that question next. Progress through the survey should proceed from that question in the list. The target question should be after the current question in the survey.

endSurvey.description: If specified, and the rule's expression is true, immediately stop evaluating rules and end the survey. The users existing answers to the survey should be sent to the server.

displayIf.description: **Before rules only.** If the rule expression is true, display this question or information screen.

displayUnless.description: **Before rules only.** If the rule expression is true, do not display this question or information. Put differently, show the screen unless the expression is true.

assignDataGroup.description: If specified, the value is a data group that should be added to the survey taker if the rule expression is true, or removed if the rule expression is false. Survey rules that specify `assignDataGroup` do not end evaluation of rules in the list; the engine should proceed to evaluate and apply the next rule in the list. The changes to the user's data groups should not be applied if the user cancels the survey.

TaskReference.description: A pointer to a task identifier defined for this app, and associated with a task to be performed as part of the mobile application health study (e.g. a walking test).

identifier.description: The identifier that defines a task on the client. Note that this value is conventional; it needs to be defined for an app but has no further meaning on the server.

Template.description: A template for messaging (SMS, email, etc.);

criteria.description: Selection criteria that can be used to determine if a given template should be used for the target user.

createdOn.description: The date and time the template was created.

modifiedOn.description: The date and time the template was last modified.

publishedCreatedOn.description: The date and time of the template revision that is the published revision to use.

deleted.description: Has this template been logically deleted (an admin can restore it)?

version.description: The optimistic locking version of the template. This value must be submitted as part of the next update of the model. If it does not match the value on the server, a 409 error (Conflict) will prevent the update from occurring. It can also serve as a key to determine if a local cache of this `Template` revision needs to be updated.

Timeline.description: A detailed description of when a participant should perform specific sessions and assessments as part of a study, along with the metadata to show UI to the participant before loading and executing code for the assessments.

duration.description: The length of time of the studyâ€™s protocol, after which the participant has completed the study. Events in the timeline will not extend past this duration in time.

totalMinutes.description: The total number of minutes to perform all the sessions in the timeline. This information is provided for informational purposes to schedule designers.

totalNotifications.description: The total number of notifications that could be shown to the participant (if all possible notifications are shown; fewer notifications may be shown since the participant may complete sessions before all reminders are shown for the session). This information is provided for informational purposes to schedule designers.

TimeWindow.description: A group of activities to be performed together in a study by a participant. The session can describe a repeating sequence that can repeat up to the length of a schedule.

guid.description: The unique identifier for this model.

startTime.description: The start time in a local time format (HH:MM), to be interpreted in the participantâ€™s current time zone.

expiration.description: After the start time, how long until this assessment should no longer be available to the participant to peform? This value can be longer than a day, but only minute, hour, day, and week values are allowed (although these can be mixed). The expiration period of a time window cannot be longer in duration than the interval of the session itself.

persistent.description: Is this time window persistent? If true, then this assessment should remain available for the participant to perform more than once until the window expires.

DateTimeHolder.description: An object that provides a timestamp.

uploadId.description: The GUID assigned to this upoad.

encrypted.description: True if the upload is encrypted. False if it is not encrypted.

schemaId.description: The ID of the schema for this upload.

schemaRevision.description: The revision for the schema of this upload.

recordId.description: The record ID of the upload in Synapse.

contentLength.description: The size of the object in bytes. A standard HTTP header. For more information, go to [http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.13](http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.13)

contentMd5.description: The base64-encoded, 128-bit MD5 digest of the upload.

requestedOn.description: The date and time (ISO 8601 format) that the client requested an URL to make an upload to the server.

completedOn.description: The date and time (ISO 8601 format) that the upload was completed.

completedBy.description: Currently the API has an endpoint for the client to call and mark an upload completed. However, there is also a process that detects uploads to S3 and marks the uploads complete. This field indicates which client completed the upload.

validationMessageList.description: An array of error messages if this upload did not pass validation.

zipped.description: True if the upload is zipped. False if it is a single file.

UploadFieldDefinition.description: Note: For legacy reasons, this is the only model object returned from the API that does not have a type property reflecting the implementation structure of the JSON. Instead, the type attribute is of the type [UploadFieldType](#UploadFieldType).

name.description: Field name. A schema cannot contain fields with the same name.

allowOtherChoices.description: Used for MULTI_CHOICE. True if the multi-choice field allows an "other" answer with user freeform text. This tells BridgeEX to reserve an "other" column for this field. Can be null, so that the number of field parameters doesn't explode.

fileExtension.description: Used for ATTACHMENT_V2 types. Used as a hint by BridgeEX to preserve the file extension as a quality-of-life improvement. Includes the period. Examples: ".json", ".csv". Optional, defaults to ".tmp".

mimeType.description: Used for ATTACHMENT_V2 types. Used as a hint by BridgeEX to mark a Synapse file handle with the correct MIME type as a quality-of-life improvement. Optional, defaults to "application/octet-stream".

maxLength.description:
Used for STRING, SINGLE_CHOICE, and INLINE_JSON_BLOB types. This is a hint for BridgeEX to create a Synapse column with the right width.

If not specified, Bridge will use the default max length of 100 (if applicable).

multiChoiceAnswerList.description:
Used for MULTI_CHOICE types. This lists all valid answers for this field. It is used by BridgeEX to create the Synapse table columns for MULTI_CHOICE fields. This is a list because order matters, in terms of Synapse column order. Must be specified if the field type is a MULTI_CHOICE.

For schemas generated from surveys, this list will be the "value" in the survey question option, or the "label" if value is not specified.

unboundedText.description: True if this field is a text-field with unbounded length. (Only applies to fields that are serialized as text, such as INLINE_JSON_BLOB, SINGLE_CHOICE, or STRING. Can be null, so that the number of field parameters doesn't explode. This flag takes precedence over the maxLength value.

UploadRequest.description: **Important: Headers of the same values must be used when doing the upload against the pre-signed URL.**

contentLength.description: The size of the object in bytes. A standard HTTP header. For more information, go to [http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.13](http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.13)

contentMd5.description: The base64-encoded, 128-bit MD5 digest of the object body.

contentType.description: A standard MIME type. For more information, go to [http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.17](http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.17)

encrypted.description: True if the upload is encrypted. False if it is not encrypted. If not specified, defaults to true.

metadata.description: JSON map with key value pairs representing metadata for this upload, as submitted by the app. This corresponds with the uploadMetadataFieldDefinitions configured in the app.

zipped.description: True if the upload is zipped. False if it is a single file. If not specified, defaults to true.

UploadSchema.description: Represents the expected fields and types for a data upload. This is used to validate incoming uploads and to export data to Synapse. See [Bridge Upload Data Format](/articles/study_design/upload_data_format.html) for more details about uploads.

maxAppVersions.description: A map of operating system names to minimum app versions. The user must send a `User-Agent` header in a prescribed format, that declares the app version to be equal to or less than this version number, in order to match.

minAppVersions.description: A map of operating system names to minimum app versions. The user must send a `User-Agent` header in a prescribed format, that declares the app version to be equal to or greater than this version number, in order to match.

moduleId.description: Module ID, if this schema was imported from a shared module.

moduleVersion.description: Module version, if this schema was imported from a shared module.

revision.description: Revision number of the schema, used to distinguish versions of the same data format. This should be blank when creating a schema, and it should be passed back to the server when updating. If the schema revision cannot be updated in a backwards-compatible fashion, the server will throw an exception. You will need to increment the revision number and create a new revision of the schema.

surveyGuid.description: If this schema is created from a survey, this is the GUID of the survey it represents.

appId.description: **Only available through worker APIs.** The identifier of the app from which this schema was retrieved.

surveyCreatedOn.description:
If this schema is created from a survey, this is the createdOn timestamp 
(in ISO 8601 format) of the survey it represents.

version.description: The optimistic locking version of the survey. This value must be submitted as part of the next update of the model. If it does not match the value on the server, a 409 error (Conflict) will prevent the update from occurring.

id.description: The upload ID. The client needs to use this ID to call Bridge when the upload is complete.

url.description: A pre-signed URL for doing a PUT upload of the data. The URL will remain valid for 24 hours once created on the Bridge side.

expires.description: The ISO 8601 date and time stamp at which this session will expire.

messageList.description: An array of error messages if failures occurred during validation.

UserConsentHistory.description: A record of a complete consent (including both the dates of consent and withdrawal, if applicable);

subpopulationGuid.description: The consent group that the participant agreed to participate in.

consentCreatedOn.description: ISO 8601 date and time that the consent was created on.

name.description: Full name as entered by the participant.

imageData.description: The signature image in a base 64 encoding.

imageMimeType.description: The IANA mime type indicator for the image (e.g. "image/png").

signedOn.description: ISO 8601 date and time that the consent was signed by the user.

withdrewOn.description: ISO 8601 date and time that the user withdrew the consent, if the user withdrew from a study (note that later consent records may re-enroll the user in the study; nothing prevents users from joining and quitting a study multiple times).

hasSignedActiveConsent.description: True if the user signed the most recently published version of the consent, false otherwise.

allOf.description: Information about the user and their session. This information cannot be updated; to update a user's record, use the StudyParticipant record and APIs.

firstName.description: First name (given name) of the user.

lastName.description: Last name (family name) of the user.

externalId.description: An externally-assignable identifier a research partner can use to re-identify a user's data in the exported data set (this must be provided by the application, it is not created by Bridge). It is a string that can be set or updated to any value without constraints, unless Bridge is configured to manage the study's external IDs. Then the ID must be submitted on sign up, and cannot be modified afterward.

id.description: An ID assigned to this account by Bridge system. This ID is exposed in the API and is different from the health code assigned to the user's anonymized data. Bridge never exports this ID along with the health code from Bridge.

notifyByEmail.description: True if the user has consented to be contacted via email outside the application, false otherwise.

attributes.description: A map of user profile attributes that have been set for this user (the attributes themselves must be specified in the app's configuration, and the values are stored encrypted in case they capture personally-identifying information).

createdOn.description: The date and time the account was created.

emailVerified.description: Has the user verified that they have control of this email address?

phoneVerified.description: Has the user verified that they have control of this phone number?

dataGroups.description: The data groups set for this user. Data groups must be strings that are defined in the list of all valid data groups for the app, as part of the app object.

clientData.description: Client data for a user should be in a syntactically valid JSON format. It will be returned as is to the client (as JSON).

languages.description: Two letter language codes to assign to this user (these are initially retrieved from the user's `Accept-Language` header and then persisted as part of account configuration).

studyIds.description: The studies this participant is associated to.

externalIds.description: The exernal IDs this participant is associated to, mapped to the study that issued the external ID. Typically a user signs up with the external ID, and is assigned to that study as a result.

sessionToken.description: The session token that must be returned to the server to access services requiring authentication.

reauthToken.description: A token, supplied when a new session is returned, that can be used to refresh the session at a later time. The API to reauthenticate with the token will refresh your session token and reset the session's timeout value. The reauthentication token can only be used one time.

dataSharing.description: True if the sharing scope is anything other than "no_sharing".

signedMostRecentConsent.description: True if all *required* consents have been signed and the versions signed are the most up-to-date versions of those consents.

synapseUserId.description: The numerical identifier for a Synapse account. For administrative accounts, this will allow the user to sign in using Synapse accounts, no further credentials are needed to access the system. This value can only be set when creating an account; otherwise the identifiers update API must be used to add the ID to an existing account.

consented.description: True if all required consents have been signed.

consentStatuses.description: A mapping from a subpopulation GUID to information about the participant's consent status in that subpopulation (whether consented or not). Only the subpopulations that currently apply to this user will have a ConsentStatus object in the map.

enrollments.description: Records of every enrollment (whether withdrawn or not) in every study for this participant. The key of this mapping is the studyId, and the value is the record of the enrollment.

orgMembership.description: The identifier of the organization this account is a member of (this will be an administrative account and not a study participant).

Verification.description: A payload to sent the email or phone verification token back to the bridge server.

sptoken.description: The token sent via email or SMS message to the user

VersionHolder.description: An object that holds the version for a created or updated entity.

version.description: The optimistic locking version of the entity.

reason.description:
An optional, free text description from the participant about why they are no longer participating in the study. Some applications provide a more structured form to the user, and convert this to a text response.

The reason will be emailed to the consent notification email address as part of the notification that this user has withdrawn from the study.

ResourceList.description: Lists from the Bridge server will be returned in a list payload that includes an `items` property with the list of objects, and a `requestParams` object that includes the values that were submitted to the server to generate the list. This list is an unpaged and complete list of all indicated items on the server.

total.description: The total number of records in the items list

ForwardCursorPagedResourceList.description:
One page of records from a source that only allows you to fetch the next page of 
resources (no random access via an index to anywhere in the set of records). The 
key to retrieve the next page of records is provided by the `nextPageOffsetKey` value.

nextPageOffsetKey.description:
The offsetKey to be provided in the next request to get the next page of 
resources.

hasNext.description: true if there is a further page of resources, false otherwise.

AccountSummaryList.description: Payload returning a list of [AccountSummary](/#AccountSummary) records.

HealthDataRecordList.description: List of health data records within a date-time range.

HealthDataRecordEx3List.description: List of health data records within a date-time range.

ScheduledActivityListV4.description: The endpoint takes a startTime (inclusive) and endTime (exclusive) to form a time range (up to 15 days). Any activity that has an active time window (from its scheduled time to its expiration time) that falls on or after the start time, and before the end time, is included in the returned tasks.

required.description: All survey questions are optional/skippable by default. Must this question be answered by the user in order to advance in the survey?

MultiValueConstraints.description:
A common question type where the participant is given a list of options to choose from. The 
UI representation of this question depends in part on whether the participant can select 
multiple values, or add another value not included in the list:

|uiHint|Description|
|---|---|
|checkbox, list|`allowMultiple` = true|
|combobox|`allowMultiple` = false, `allowOther` = true|
|radiobutton, select, slider|`allowMultiple` = false, `allowOther` = false|

allowOther.description:
True if the user should be able to enter another value besides those provided in the
enumeration, false otherwise.

allowMultiple.description:
Can multiple values be returned as an answer? True if the client should submit multiple
values, false otherwise.

enumeration.description: The options presented for selection to the user.

IntegerConstraints.description:
This type can be used to collect a number, or with a unit, it can be used to collect 
a measure or a duration (e.g. "3 hours", or "180 pounds").

**UI hints:** numberfield, slider, select.

minValue.description: Minimum valid value. Required if UIHint is slider or select.

maxValue.description: Maximum valid value. Required if UIHint is slider or select.

step.description:
In increase or decrease in valid values, e.g. a step of 5 for a question that 
records weight to the nearest 5 pounds.

DecimalConstraints.description:
A floating point value.

**UI hints:** numberfield, slider, select.

minValue.description: Minimum valid value. Required if UIHint is slider or select.

maxValue.description: Maximum valid value. Required if UIHint is slider or select.

step.description:
In increase or decrease in valid values, e.g. a step of 0.1 for a question that records
water drunk in tenths of a liter.

StringConstraints.description:
A string answer. 

**UI hints:** texfield, multilinetext.

minLength.description: The minimum number of characters that should be allowed.

maxLength.description: The maximum number of characters that should be allowed.

pattern.description:
A regular expression pattern (omitting slashes) against with the input 
should be validated.

patternErrorMessage.description:
If a pattern is provided, an error message is required, explaining the desired format if the 
data does not fit the pattern.

patternPlaceholder.description:
An example of the data to be entered, usually shown in or next to the input control 
(e.g. "###-###-####" for a US telephone number). This is not required, but it is desirable.

allowFuture.description: Should this question allow answers in the future?

allowPast.description: Should this question allow answers in the past?

earliestValue.description: ISO 8601 date and time value that is the earliest value that may be set for this question. If allowFuture is false, that constraint should also be applied regardless of earliest/latestValue constraints.

latestValue.description: ISO 8601 date and time value that is the earliest value that may be set for this question. If allowFuture is false, that constraint should also be applied regardless of earliest/latestValue constraints.

DateConstraints.description:
A date without a time value (e.g. "2016-07-28").

**UI hints:** datepicker.

allowFuture.description: Should this question allow answers in the future?

allowPast.description: Should this question allow answers in the past?

earliestValue.description: ISO 8601 date value that is the earliest value that may be set for this question. If allowFuture is false, that constraint should also be applied regardless of earliest/latestValue constraints.

latestValue.description: ISO 8601 date value that is the earliest value that may be set for this question. If allowFuture is false, that constraint should also be applied regardless of earliest/latestValue constraints.

PostalCodeConstraints.description:
A data type for capturing partial postal code information. Although postal codes can be useful for locating users, combined with other information (such as gender and birthdate, or a rare disease condition), they can be identifying. For this reason there is guidance to the client on how this data can be collected, while preserving anonymity: 

* Canada (CA) - The first three characters of a Canadian postal code describe a sorting area of about 7,000 households. No specific guidance is given, but collecting the first 3 characters has been deemed reasonable. 
* United States (US) - collect only the first three digits of a zip code. Some 3 digit codes describe areas of 20,000 or less people; for these exceptional codes, substitute the value "000" instead before submitting to the server. If the survey constraints indicate that a US zip code is required, the `sparseZipCodePrefixes` array will be included in the constraint, with a list of these special partial zip codes. They are provided by the server so they can be updated based on new census information without having to update the survey or the client.

One way to protect the anonymity of the user is to limit the combination of partially identifying information that is asked for in a survey. For example do no ask for a specific birthdate in a survey where the information will be submitted to the server. This makes a partial postal code significantly less useful for reidentification.

**UI hints:** postalcode.

sparseZipCodePrefixes.description: Some 3 digit codes describe areas of 20,000 or less people; for these exceptional codes, which can more easily be used to reidentify participants, substitute the value "000" instead before submitting the survey answer to the server. If the survey constraints indicate that a US zip code is required, the `sparseZipCodePrefixes` array will be included in the constraint, with a list of these special partial zip codes.

YearMonthConstraints.description:
A year and month without a date or time (e.g. "2016-07").

**UI hints:** yearmonth.

allowFuture.description: Should this question allow answers in the future? If the current date falls in a month after the indicated month, it is considered to be in the future.

allowPast.description: Should this question allow answers in the past? If the current date falls in a month prior to the indicated month, it is considered to be in the past.

earliestValue.description: ISO 8601 year and month value ("YYYY-MM") that is the earliest value that may be set for this question.  If allowFuture is false, that constraint should also be applied regardless of earliest/latestValue constraints.

latestValue.description: ISO 8601 year and month value ("YYYY-MM") that is the earliest value that may be set for this question. If allowFuture is false, that constraint should also be applied regardless of earliest/latestValue constraints.

YearConstraints.description:
A year value (e.g. "2016").

**UI hints:** year, numberfield, slider.

allowFuture.description: Should this question allow answers in the future? If the current date falls in a month after the indicated month, it is considered to be in the future.

allowPast.description: Should this question allow answers in the past? If the current date falls in a month prior to the indicated month, it is considered to be in the past.

earliestValue.description: An ISO 8601 compliant, four digit year value.

latestValue.description: An ISO 8601 compliant, four digit year value.

TimeConstraints.description:
This is an ISO 8601 time value, in 24 hour time, milliseconds and seconds are optional, and there 
is no time zone for this value (e.g. 14:45:15.357). This represents a time of the day, regardless 
of where the user is, e.g. "I take my medications at 3:00pm every day, whether I'm in Chicago or Tokyo."

**UI hints:** timepicker.

DurationConstraints.description:
Deprecated. Use an integer value with a unit of measure instead.

Durations should be given as an integer value (not an ISO 8601 duration value). For the time being, a duration string is accepted if the duration is measured in the same time units required by the question. For example, if the question requires minutes, the duration string must be "PT120M", not "PT2H" or other equivalent values.

**UI hints:** numberfield, slider, select.

minValue.description: Maximum valid value. Required if UIHint is slider or select.

maxValue.description: Minimum valid value. Required if UIHint is slider or select.

step.description:
In increase or decrease in valid values, e.g. a step of 5 for a question that records weight 
to the nearest 5 pounds.

BloodPressureConstraints.description:
Systolic and diastolic systemic arterial pressure.

**UI hints:** bloodpressure

HeightConstraints.description:
A floating point value.

**UI hints:** weight.

forInfant.description: Is this measurement for an infant?

WeightConstraints.description:
A floating point value.

**UI hints:** weight.

forInfant.description: Is this measurement for an infant?

304.description: The requested resource has not been modified since the last time it was requested. Bridge server support for 3xx responses is limited to a few endpoints intended to be used by mobile clients, through the use of the `If-Modified-Since` header.

400.description:
The submitted JSON payload has validation errors. It must be changed before it can be 
sucessfully re-submitted. Individual errors are provided in a map that is keyed to the 
JSON object structure.

403.description: User cannot access this service because they do not have an administrative role.

410.description:
The version of the client making the request no longer has access to this service. The user 
must update their app in order to continue using Bridge.

412.description: User has signed in, but is not consented

400_published_entity.description: Bad Request. The request cannot be completed because the entity is in a published (locked) state.

403_not_administrative.description: User cannot access this service because they do not have an administrative role.

403_not_admin.description: User cannot access this service because they are not an admin (no admin role on account).

403_not_admin_developer.description: User cannot access this service because they are not a developer or admin (no developer or admin role on account).

403_not_admin_study_designer_developer.y.description: User cannot access this service because they do not have an administrative role (no admin, study designer who is a member of the organization that owns the object, or developer role on account).

403_not_admin_worker.description: User cannot access this service because they are not a worker process or admin (no worker or admin role on account).

403_not_developer.description: User cannot access this service because they are not a developer (no developer role on account).

403_not_developer_researcher.description: User cannot access this service because they are not a developer or researcher (no developer or researcher role on account, or a developer is attempting an operation on a non-test account that is not the developer account itself).

403_not_developer_researcher_worker.description: User cannot access this service because they are not a developer or researcher (no developer, researcher or worker role on account, or a developer is attempting an operation on a non-test account that is not the developer account itself).

403_not_developer_researcher_admin.description: User cannot access this service because they do not have an administrative role (no developer, worker or admin role on account, or a developer is attempting an operation on a non-test account that is not the developer account itself).

403_not_developer_worker.description:
User cannot access this service because they are not a developer or worker process 
(no developer or worker role on account, or a developer is attempting an operation on a non-test account that is not the developer account itself).

403_not_developer_researcher_study_desig.description: User cannot access this service because they do not have an administrative role (no developer, researcher, study designer or coordinator, or the developer/study designer is not operating on a test account or their own account).

403_not_researcher.description: User cannot access this service because they are not a researcher (no researcher role on account).

403_not_study_coordinator.description: User cannot access this service because they do not have an administrative role (no study coordinator role on account).

403_not_study_coordinator_developer.description: User cannot access this service because they do not have an administrative role (no study coordinator or developer role on account).

403_not_study_coordinator_researcher.description: User cannot access this service because they do not have an administrative role (no study coordinator or researcher role on account).

403_not_study_coordinator_admin.description: User cannot access this service because they do not have an administrative role (no study coordinator or admin role on account).

403_not_study_designer_coordinator.yml.description: User cannot access this service because they do not have an administrative role (no study coordinator or study designer role on account).

403_not_study_designer_developer.yml.description: User cannot access this service because they do not have an administrative role (no study designer who is a member of the organization that owns the object, or a developer role on account).

403_not_superadmin.description: User cannot access this service because they are not an superadmin (a cross-app administrator).

403_not_superadmin_worker.description: User cannot access this service because they are not a worker process or superadmin (no worker or superadmin role on account).

403_not_worker.description: User cannot access this service because they are not a worker process (no worker role on account).
